answers.answer: The Galați County Immigration Service can be contacted at gl.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0236 407 292 and 0236 407 000.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Important contacts Galați'.

answers.answer: Asylum seekers can get help by contacting the Regional Center for Procedures and Accommodation of Asylum Seekers via email at c.galati.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0236 323 878.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Important contacts Galați'.

answers.answer: Registration for temporary protection in Galați can be done at the Regional Center for Procedures and Accommodation of Asylum Seekers Galați (Str. Săvinești, no. 2) or the Immigration Office of Galati County (Str. Domnească no. 102).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Temporary protection in Galați'.

answers.answer: Medical services are available at the County Emergency Clinical Hospital "Sf. Apostol Andrei" Galați, the Emergency Clinical Hospital for Children "Sf. Ioan" Galați, and through a list of family doctors.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Children can access emergency medical care by going to the Emergency Clinical Hospital for Children "Sf. Ioan" Galați.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Organizations offering psychological support include Project HOPE, Positive Progress psychological Solutions, Terre des hommes Foundation, Save the Children, The International Organization for Migration (IOM), Plan International Organization, and Red Cross Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Refugees from Ukraine can get psychological help from Positive Progress psychological Solutions, Terre des hommes Foundation, and Plan International Organization.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Psychological consultations are available in Ukrainian, Russian, Romanian, English, and Polish.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Children can enroll in state kindergartens and nurseries, or in private kindergartens such as Clever Kids Kindergarten, which has groups specifically for Ukrainian children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: The Jesuit Refugee Service (JRS) offers free Romanian language courses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Organizations offering general support in Galați include JRS Romania, Red Cross Galați, Save the Children, CNRR, Fundatia Inimă de Copil, AIDRom, Asociația pentru Ajutor Umanitar AJUT, and Help to Ukraine Galați Association.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: AIDRom provides social and legal advice and information as part of its support services, which also include social assistance, medical consultations, and support for education and labor market access.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center provides support for accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania, with the expertise and support of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
